business.headline: Taxed into the pit lane: Why India's Formula 1 dream ran out of trackFormula 1 didn't leave India because of a lack of fans or infrastructure. It left because of unclear policies, tax confusion, and a system that didn't treat it like a sport.

Meta hires ChatGPT co-creator as chief scientist to lead new AI labMeta has appointed ChatGPT co-creator Shengjia Zhao as chief scientist of its new Superintelligence Lab, aiming to advance AGI and regain AI leadership after Llama 4's weak performance.

Explained: Why India-UK free trade agreement is a big deal for both nationsIndia and the United Kingdom have formally sealed a Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, a deal described as the "biggest, most economically significant trade deal that the UK has made since leaving the EU."

Not a shareholder, no coercion: Sunjay Kapur's firm counters mother's chargesThe clarification comes after it was reported that Rani Kapur had written a letter to delay the AGM and alleged that she was made to sign documents shortly after her son's death.

Remainers will choke on their cornflakes: British media hails India trade dealThe India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) or the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) seeks to enhance bilateral trade by around USD 34 billion annually, besides ensuring better market access.

FTAs with EU, US in talks, says Commerce Secretary after India-UK trade dealThe agreement now needs to pass through both houses of the British Parliament. A special committee will study it before giving final approval.

Everyone wants to be an influencer. But can it pay the bills?The creator economy in India is booming, but the economics remain shaky. What started as a hobby or side hustle for many is now a full-time hustle, and an increasingly competitive one.

Sensex ends 721 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; Bajaj Finance falls 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 721.08 points to 81,463.09 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 225.10 points to trade at 24,837.

Sunjay Kapur's mother alleges business coercion, attempt to 'usurp family legacy'Rani Kapur has publicly objected to what she calls an "inappropriate and premature" AGM, held during a period of deep mourning, and raised serious concerns over how decisions are being made in the aftermath.

This key agreement in UK trade deal will hugely benefit Indian firms, workersOne of the key parts of the India-UK trade deal is the introduction of the Double Contribution Convention (DCC), which is expected to help Indian professionals working in the UK by reducing their social security burden.

Filing ITR under old regime? Claim these 5 home loan tax benefits If you are sticking to the old tax regime this year, make sure you don't miss out on the big tax savings your home loan can offer. Here are five home loan benefits you must know for your ITR.

entertainment.headline: Diljit distributes sweets as he wraps Border 2, Varun Dhawan, Ahan Shetty reactDiljit Dosanjh has wrapped the shooting of his upcoming film 'Border 2'. In a video shared by the singer-turned-actor, he distributed sweets on the sets.

Is Farah Khan against 8-hour shifts? Director reacts to ongoing buzzFilmmaker Farah Khan has hinted that she doesn't support the idea of an eight-hour workday in the film industry. Her remark comes amid the ongoing debate sparked by Deepika Padukone's reported exit from Spirit over work-hour demands.

Akshay Kumar confirms return of Hera Pheri trio, says announcement coming soonAkshay Kumar has confirmed that all issues around 'Hera Pheri 3' have been resolved and the original team is reuniting. He assured fans that an official announcement would be made soon.

Akshay Kumar praises Ahaan-Aneet after Saiyaara success, welcomes them to industryAkshay Kumar shared his appreciation for 'Saiyaara'. The actor congratulated the entire team and praised newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda.

Mallika Sherawat reacts to mandali singing Bheege Honth in Mumbai local. WatchActor Mallika Sherawat shared a viral video of a bhajan mandali singing her iconic song 'Bheege Honth Tere' from 'Murder' inside a Mumbai local.

Curious case of missing dance from dance numbers - no choreography, only clickbaitOnce driven by choreography, dance numbers now rely on their potential to go viral. Industry insiders, including actors, directors, trade analysts, and choreographers, weigh in.

Ektaa Kapoor denies association with ALTT amid ban for vulgar contentTV Czarina Ektaa Kapoor denied her association with ALTT after the government banned the app for vulgar content. Kapoor stated that she had stepped down from her association with the app in June 2021.

Fantastic Four box office Day 1: Marvel film earns Rs 5 crore amid Saiyaara crazeMarvel Studios' 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' opened modestly in India, earning Rs 5.10 crore on its first day, facing stiff competition from the Bollywood hit 'Saiyaara'.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu box office Day 2: Pawan Kalyan's film sees a huge dipPawan Kalyan's 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' saw a sharp decline at the box office on its second day, earning Rs 8 crore after an impressive Rs 47.50 crore opening.

Saiyaara box office Day 8: Mohit Suri film continues strong run, earns Rs 190 croreMohit Suri's 'Saiyaara' has been earning tremendous love from all quarters. The movie, starring debutant Ahaan Panday alongside Aneet Padda, earned Rs 190 crore in just eight days.

Actor Ruchi Gujjar files complaint against film producer over financial fraudActress Ruchi Gujjar has filed an FIR against producer Karan Singh Chauhan over a Rs 24 lakh fraud linked to a TV serial deal. She alleges misuse of funds and intimidation after demanding her money back.

After harassment claims, Tanushree Dutta says she is leading quiet, spiritual lifeActor Tanushree Dutta stated that she was overwhelmed with constant media requests for interviews. She had recently claimed about facing life threat at her home in Mumbai.

Shruti Haasan promises a brave new world as father Kamal Haasan joins Rajya SabhaActor Kamal Haasan was sworn in as Rajya Sabha MP in Delhi. His actor-daughter Shruti Haasan dedicated an emotional post to him, highlighting the personal side of his political milestone.

Did you know that Saiyaara's Ahaan Panday is a Blackpink fan?Ahaan Panday astonished fans with an unexpected K-pop revelation, naming BLACKPINK's Lisa as his favourite idol. The admission sent Indian K-pop enthusiasts into a frenzy. Read more here.
Suhana Khan, Agastya Nanda attend event in New York, singer Tesher joinsSuhana Khan and Agastya Nanda attended an event together in New York. Pictures of them partying have emerged online.

Mohit Suri's Saiyaara captures Gen Z's raw and real love storyMohit Suri's Saiyaara has become a cultural hit among Gen Z for its raw portrayal of young love. The film's focus on mental health and emotional depth sparks new conversations about romance and relationships.

Ed Sheeran loved Arijit's voice so much, he released a new version of SapphireSinger Ed Sheeran has expressed high praise for Arijit Singh in a detailed post, saying he loves his voice. Both versions of 'Sapphire', which feature intricate South Asian percussion, were produced by Ilya Salmanzadeh, Johnny McDaid, and Savan Kotecha.

Karan Johar on being isolated as a kid for being too feminine: Wasn't boy enoughKaran Johar opened up about his childhood struggles with being labelled as feminine. He recalled his challenges as a child in seeking acceptance and belonging from his peers.

general news.headline: Sad to support a regime...: Chirag Paswan's big attack on Nitish KumarChirag Paswan said the law and order situation in the state is out of control and added that he feels sad to be supporting a government where crime continues unchecked.

Deeply distressing: Supreme Court issues guidelines to curb student suicidesThe guidelines call for measures such as mandatory mental health counseling, functional grievance redressal systems and regulatory oversight in all educational settings.

Udaipur college on boil after student dies by suicide alleging torture by staffA handwritten note found at the location accuses staff members of the college of harassment, citing irregularities in exam schedules, arbitrary failure of students, and repeated monetary demands.

It was my mistake: Rahul Gandhi admits failure in understanding OBC plightReflecting on his 21-year political career, Rahul Gandhi said he had done justice to several issues, including the land acquisition bill, MGNREGA, the food bill, and the rights of tribal communities.

Power, pollution, politics: The great hypocrisy of India's VIP cavalcadeIndia's political and administrative leaders routinely travel in massive, fuel-hungry cavalcades — fleets whose carbon footprints are far larger than they appear in passing. The cavalcades in Indian are seen as a symbol of power, reach and position.

Jasprit Bumrah may retire from Tests: Kaif fears pacer lost physical battleFormer Indian cricketer Mohammad Kaif fears the worst. He reckons that Jasprit Bumrah could retire from Test cricket after not being able to meet the physical demands that come with the longest format.

Avoid travel to border: India issues advisory on Cambodia amid clash with ThailandThe Indian Embassy in Cambodia issued travel advisories urging nationals to avoid border areas amid the most intense fighting in 13 years between Thailand and Cambodia over disputed territory.

Revamp tensions in BJP-RSS: Why the Sangh stamp is all overThe RSS is no longer content playing second fiddle. It is not just shaping state appointments in the BJP but also the central leadership transition

Curious case of missing dance from dance numbers - no choreography, only clickbaitOnce driven by choreography, dance numbers now rely on their potential to go viral. Industry insiders, including actors, directors, trade analysts, and choreographers, weigh in.

From 'India Out' to most trusted friend: PM, Maldives' Muizzu recalibrate tiesDuring his visit to the Maldives, Prime Minister Narendra Modi reaffirmed the deep historical and strategic ties between the two nations, announced a Rs 4,850 crore credit line, and held wide-ranging talks with President Mohamed Muizzu.

Students raised alarm before Rajasthan school roof caved in: Teachers scolded usThe teachers were allegedly having breakfast outside the area where the roof of the school in Rajasthan collapsed — the same place where students had gathered for the morning assembly.
Valour of brave sons: Tributes pour in as India celebrates Kargil Vijay DiwasKargil Vijay Diwas is observed every year on July 26 to commemorate India's victory over Pakistan in 1999.

Labubus of the world unite, but not at Karl Marx's graveIn a capitalism-dominated world, where superficiality sells and sincerity scrolls by unnoticed, it took a designer Labubu doll to make a handwritten letter left at German philosopher Karl Marx's grave go viral. The irony is even Marx's grave hasn't gone untouched by consumerism.

What's ailing Jasprit Bumrah? Manchester misfire raises red flagsENG vs IND, 4th Test: While some of the biggest batters were allowed to fail for long periods, the scrutiny on Bumrah's wicket column has been immense. Day 3 in Manchester was again a stark reminder of the fact that he isn't the magic wand that can make up for the tactical blunders of the team.

Taxed into the pit lane: Why India's Formula 1 dream ran out of trackFormula 1 didn't leave India because of a lack of fans or infrastructure. It left because of unclear policies, tax confusion, and a system that didn't treat it like a sport.

Astronomer hires Chris Martin's ex-wife as spokesperson days after kiss cam scandalAstronomer appointed Gwyneth Paltrow, former wife of Chris Martin, as its interim spokesperson after a viral 'kiss cam' incident involving the company's now-resigned CEO Andy Byron and HR head Kristin Cabot.

How an India-US spy mission lost a nuclear device in the HimalayasAfter China's first atomic test, the US and India, as part of a covert operation, tried to place a nuclear-powered listening device at 25,000 feet in the Himalayas near the Nanda Devi peak. A blizzard forced the CIA-IB team to leave the device on the route. A recovery mission, and several search operations, failed to locate the device.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Infiltrators won't be allowed...: Chirag Paswan backs Bihar voter roll clean-upChirag Paswan, Union Minister, criticises Opposition's stand on Bihar voter list revision. He emphasises the necessity of the process and dismisses concerns of injustice, urging the opposition to support the Election Commission's efforts.

Kedarnath Yatra halted as Uttarakhand hit by landslides, flash floodsIn Rudraprayag, the pedestrian route from Gaurikund to Kedarnath was shut around 3.30 am on Saturday after a landslide blocked the path with falling debris and boulders. Authorities have halted movement on the stretch, and work is underway to clear the route.

Sam Altman warns ChatGPT isn't a therapist, your secrets aren't legally privateOpenAI CEO Sam Altman cautions users that conversations with ChatGPT lack legal confidentiality and could be disclosed in court until clear privacy laws are established.

Trump says Hamas wants to die, urges Israel to 'finish the job' in GazaCalling Hamas unwilling to negotiate, President Trump urged Israel to "clean it up" in Gaza and "finish the job," after US-brokered truce talks broke down and hostilities resumed.

From Kargil to Operation Sindoor: Two decades of military transformation in IndiaWhile the valour, courage and determination of the Indian Armed Forces remain the same, in terms of technology and warfare, the Indian Military has come a long way from Operation Vijay to Operation Sindoor.

4th Test: Wheels come off for India in Manchester as Joe Root rewrites recordsEngland vs India, 4th Test: India conceded 319 runs as England seized control on Day 3 in Manchester. Joe Root scored a commanding 150, climbing to second place on the all-time list of Test run-scorers and leading what could be a series-defining batting charge for the hosts.

Diljit distributes sweets as he wraps Border 2, Varun Dhawan, Ahan Shetty reactDiljit Dosanjh has wrapped the shooting of his upcoming film 'Border 2'. In a video shared by the singer-turned-actor, he distributed sweets on the sets.

Her remark comes amid the ongoing debate sparked by Deepika Padukone's reported exit from Spirit over work-hour demands.

sports.headline: 4th Test Day 4 Live: Will rain rescue India in Manchester?India (IND) vs England (ENG), 4th Test, Day 4 Live Score and Updates: Shubman Gill's Indian cricket team is on the backfoot after taking a heavy beating on Day 3 of the Test match. The Indian side will look for some good fortune from the rain gods and hope to bat deep to save the Test match.

Jasprit Bumrah may retire from Tests: Kaif fears pacer lost physical battleFormer Indian cricketer Mohammad Kaif fears the worst. He reckons that Jasprit Bumrah could retire from Test cricket after not being able to meet the physical demands that come with the longest format.

Watch: Anna Kalinskaya's dog adorably runs on court to celebrate owner's victoryWashington Open 2025: Anna Kalinskaya's dog Bella raced towards her owner after the 6-3, 7-5 win over Clara Tauson in the quarterfinals of the WTA 500 tournament.

India's injury crisis: Is IPL the main reason behind constant niggles in Tests?India's bowling unit struggled on Day 3 of the Manchester Test amid injuries and fatigue. Morne Morkel said that it has been difficult to manage workloads given the bowlers came into the Test series straight after the IPL.

Joe Root has made it clear that he doesn't play for stats: Ricky PontingENG vs IND, 4th Test: Joe Root scored 150 off 248 balls as England took a substantial 186-run lead at Stumps on Day 3 of the ongoing Test at the Old Trafford in Manchester.

Tim David reveals using Russell's bat to hit fastest T20I century for AustraliaWI vs AUS, 3rd T20I: Tim David hit the fastest hundred in T20Is by an Australian, helping Australia beat the West Indies by six wickets to seal the five-match series 3-0.

Ollie Pope backs Joe Root to chase down Sachin Tendulkar's Test recordIndia vs England: Senior England batter Joe Root has become the second highest run-scorer in Test cricket after a magnificent 150-run innings in the 4th Test. Will he be able to break Sachin Tendulkar's feat of most runs in Test cricket?

Tim David's historic century powers Australia to T20I series win vs West IndiesWI vs AUS, 3rd T20I: Tim David hit Australia's fastest hundred in T20Is off 37 balls as the visitors sealed the five-match series with a dominating six-wicket win at the Warner Park in Basseterre, St Kitts.

Humpy vs Deshmukh: All you need to know about Chess World Cup finalKoneru Humpy and Divya Deshmukh are set to face each other in the all-India final at the Chess World Cup final, starting Saturday, July 26. While Humpy beat Tingjie Lei in the semis, Deshmukh got the better of Zhongyi Tan.

Jasprit Bumrah not injured, need more energy on flat decks: Morne MorkelIndia bowling coach Morne Morkel said that Jasprit Bumrah wasn't injured after the Indian pacer was seen favouring his left ankle during the second session of Day 3. Morkel also admitted that the Indian pacers were lacking a bit of energy that was needed on the flat Manchester pitch.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
